channel.title: Website App?
channel.description:
How would i go about making a downloadable application that does the following:
person clicks application -->
Application then opens -->
Application loads the desired page ( for an example, hit leap app )
I want the app, to load up http://www.rawpaste.com
i made an exe, but it only supports windows XP, and must have firefox
Is there a bat command or any other kind of coding that would allow me to do this
Framing it would also be better than loading persons web browser

item.title: Website App?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

if you are referring to ‘app’ as in mobile app development:

ios
if you have a mac, or install a virtual machine on your computer, you can download xCode

if you don’t have a mac, and refuse to install a virtual machine:

jQueryMobile -> PhoneGap
^ simple method seeing as you’re only going to be using a website, and not much more.

you can look into nomad, marmalade, or corona.

you can also use winchain

you can also look into services like xcodeclub and macincloud

for android/kindle/nook/blackberry:
just download the sdk

if you were referring to ‘app’ as in application, for computers.
you can use javafx

http://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/webview/jfxpub-webview.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Website App?
item.dc:creator: @ImJaws ImJaws
item.description:
@ImJaws wrote:

If you are going to use visual basic .Net Framework
(which supports all windows versions etc…)

Add a webbrowser and paste in this code…

Public Class Form1

    Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
        WebBrowser1.Navigate("http://www.google.com/")
    End Sub
End Class

Read full topic

item.title: Website App?
item.dc:creator: @Server_Sniffer Server Sniffer
item.description:
@Server_Sniffer wrote:

HcoJustin:

If you don’t care about using the user’s browser you can use Desktop.getDesktop().browse(URI) in Java

Im no good at making the applet, How would i make that lol?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

This is better suited in general programming due to the fact that the app only loads up the website and isn’t actually anything to do with website development.
